pamelri tavu' i ini na temuwakutra kana dawa.

ulra a eman nu naniwanan?
What do you sell?

manueman paisu nu tremima' ta kanini na zuwaya.
How much for both?

a zuwa leman lima pulu' paisu peniya.
250 dollars in total.

a lima leman i ini.

'azi maruwa, kasipun ku nu ku pulusuwaw.

ai, nu kemazu mu, verayay ku za saya a kiping na 'uze'uzem.
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

aelak ku kanini na kamutr zi na siuy.

a zuwa kuzulr paisu peniya. dinawayan kanangku lima i ini, kasawariyan zi 'azi kakuwatreng.

ku palrazamaw ku 'ali'an mu, karuwa pulusu ziya za saema?

Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

manueman paisu na kiping?
How much for the clothes?

na kiping a saya mu, telu leman lima pulu' paisu, a teluwa mu sa kuzulr.
One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

tremima' ku za saya, verayay ku kana vekal.
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.
大家好。我們開始了。: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。

'inavayan. maranger ku tremima' za kinaveras zi za 'alum na milramumu.
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.
大家好。我們開始了。: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。

uniyan lra na maderu. ulra ziya na 'avay na mitana'. tratrima' u?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

ai, ku avakanay kannu na 'avay za luvuk.
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.

meredek ku i takesiyan a pituwa tuki harem kana wari.
I arrived at school at seven today.

kemiyarakaz lra temakesi, musavak na sinsi kana talrevaw, kema na pancang, “katikezir! sungal!”
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”
大家好。我們開始了。: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」

kema'izang mi marengay, “'inavayan sinsi.”
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

a temakesi mi mu, tu panadamaw mi kana sinsi za aiyupan. kananta piningaiyan.
In class, the teacher taught us the Pinuyumayan language of numbers.
大家好。我們開始了。: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。

iturus mi kana sinsi miyup, zi semenay mi kana senay na aiyupan.
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.
大家好。我們開始了。: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。

sazu ku nilrazalrazam nanta piningaiyan.
I have learned many Pinuyumayan languages.

kana wariwari mukuwa ku i takesiyan, kana wariwari menadanadam ku kanata piningaiyan, rarengay ku pakinger kani inani.
I go to school every day, I learn the Pinuyumayan language every day, and I want to tell my mother.
大家好。我們開始了。: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。

i Inor nanku ngadan.
My name is Inor.

i Asing tu ngadan ni amalri
My dad’s name is Asing.

muketrep ku 'ami harem kana 'ami.
I am 10 years old.

ulra i ivalri, i Singkay nantu ngadan, muketrep misama' za saya nantu 'ami harem.
I have a brother, his name is Singkay, he is 11 years old.
大家好。我們開始了。: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Singkay，他今年11歲。

mukasa mi temakesi kana maresan na takesiyan.
We study in the same school.
大家好。我們開始了。: 我們在同一間學校讀書。

sahar mi semenay iniyam i ivalri na ma'inayan.
Both my brother and I like to sing.

sahar ku melrangulranguya nu katalaulepan, marelrang mi saruma'enan mukuwa melrangulranguya.
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.
大家好。我們開始了。: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。

sahar ku malrazam za vekal za 'ali'an, karuwa mi mukasa semenasenay zi melrangulranguy.
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.
大家好。我們開始了。: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。

a alrak ku za Pinuyumayan.
I am an Pinuyumayan child.

lralruwatr mi saruma'enan.
There are five people in our family.

tatelu mi maruwadiyadi.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.
大家好。我們開始了。: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。

i inku, i amalri, i inani, i ivalri na ma'inayan zi i ivalri na vavayan mukasa mi kazu.
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.
大家好。我們開始了。: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。

tihasar i amalri, a kinsas i intaw.
My father is tall and he is a policeman.
大家好。我們開始了。: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。

nu kazu i ruma' i amalri, temarapinuyumayan kimazayar kaniyam.
My father speaks the Pinuyumayan language with us at home.
大家好。我們開始了。: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。

kana katalaulepan nu derun murumaruma' mi i zekalr.
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

mukasa mi mukuwa kikakiyasa iniyam na ivalri.
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.
大家好。我們開始了。: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。

marelrang mi iniyam i inani mukuwa muzangiya harem kana wari.
I went out with my mother today.

kemayan mi kana tralutralun mekan za pang, tu 'uninay mi kana 'unin, salaw sadeku.
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.
大家好。我們開始了。: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。

a piya kare'alri, demuni' na lingatr.
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

kiumalr ku kani inani, kemuda zi demuni' na lingatr?
I asked my mother why the sky is red.
大家好。我們開始了。: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。

uniyan za kutrekutrem na lingatr, mupatraran lra na vitu'en.
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.
大家好。我們開始了。: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。

muwaruma' mi lra.
We were going home too.

kiyami ku kana vitu'en i dalan a muwaruma' mi.
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,
大家好。我們開始了。: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，

kiyalrimayan za 'azi zuwa na variw, maranger ku ziya mukuwa muzangiya.
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.
大家好。我們開始了。: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。

ulra nanku takesiyan i ngidiran i kaniyam, kana wariwari ziya kemakawang ku mukuwa i takesiyan, zi kemakawang muruma'.
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

'azi ma'izang naniyam takesiyan, kaitayan na temakakesi, marekalrazam mi mapiya.
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.
大家好。我們開始了。: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。

na temakakesi ziya, mareparazuk i renarenazan, mukasa malimali, mazayazayar.
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.
大家好。我們開始了。: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。

na sinsiyan mu, mukasa kaniniyam muwazangi kamawan za ma'izang za ruma' na takesiyan.
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.
大家好。我們開始了。: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。

ulra na trau mukuwa mitrula za lataw, ulra na maidap za dare'.

niyam idapay ziya i puyupuyung kana takesiyan, marepuwalraalrang mi mapiya, mukirungetr na takesiyan kana wariwari.

salaw tavu' tu sinalem na taramunah ni imu, imaran.

sahar ku 'emau tu kurisepa ni imu, 'inava nu 'emau ta.

大家好。我們開始了。: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。

大家好。我們開始了。: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。

harem, muruma' mi lra i Tayhok, 'azi mi malrazam za tu atrevungay lra nantu otobay?
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.
大家好。我們開始了。: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。

a lralrak mi ziya kaazu mi i Mulivelivek, a temakesi mi lra muasalr mi mukuwa kazuwa i Tawyuan, kazu mi i tokay muvaaw.

temakesi ku lra kana daygak, mukuwa ku menadanadama za mikireeman kana kakuwayanan kana Yuancumin, malrazam ku lra kana Yuancumin i Taiwan ulra tu kakuwayanan a marekamelrimelri.

semeneng, mukasa ku kani ivalri na ma'inayan mukuwa kiyumalra kana dawdawan i zekalr. maranger mi malrazam za naniyam kukuwayanan.
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.
大家好。我們開始了。: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。

walu pulu' lra tu 'ami na dawdawan, mawmu, maresan maralralrak ziya nu mena'u ta.

kiyumalr ku kanintaw za sayhu u za emaeman ngai. dalus nu temarapinuyumayan i intaw. sayhu temarabunun, temarapayrang, zi temaradipung.

ku kiyumalray i intaw mu, malrazam ku lra za a lralrak ziya i intaw mu menanadam za ngai za Dipung. a Bunun tu 'azin, malrazam i intaw za sazu a Payrang i kiyakarunan zi sayhu merengay za kemani sazu za ngai.
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Bunun, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.

mazayazayar mi mu, merengay na dawdawan za sazu a kinadaman za vulrtrengan za pa'alrupan.

demaulr mi za wadadiyanan, mukasa ta mekana za karaviyan za merevawan.

nu parasan, nu parepuwan, nu paretelun mu, taw pavulasay za emaeman na nintaw.

mawmu, ulra tu kakuwayanan na kuwatreng, marayas 'azi pavavuliyas tu kinavulasan.

merengay na sanadaman kanintaw, halrana 'azi muwai u murung ziyanay, zi 'azi u pavaveliyas na emaeman na pavulas kaninu.

nu 'uninan lra, mirawa muruma' nazu.

muramawan karuwa dika mukasa kana ma'izangan mukuwa 'emalrupa, menadanadam ku demaway za petrir kana wawariwari. kadika tatena' mirawa ku petrir kema ku.

mena'u i amalri mu, zi merengay kaninku, nu kaidaidan mu, 'azika'a'azi u a mutuma'alrup za kerevatan.

i inku zi i ama na maralrak mazayazayar mi i kiya'ezengan, marengay za sazu za vativatiyan i intaw.

marengay ku, “nu 'inava lra tu kuwi ni ama na maralrak mu, alamu ziya i kaniyam muzangiya.”

kazu kana 2022 'ami, pakaygi na séhu kana karuwa pusavak za tu ngadan na 'atayan i mibunsiyo na Yécumin.

kiumaumalr ku lra kani Avarang mawna vangesaran i zekalr na sawariyan kiyami pakirev kana séhu za “pusavakaw za tu ngadan na 'atayan.” i mibunsiyo.
I interviewed Avarang, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.
大家好。我們開始了。: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Avarang。

kanini na kasede'an i inku zi i intaw makakuret mi kana auwa kanantu ruma' kiumaumalr kantaw.
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.
大家好。我們開始了。: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。

kazu kana kiumaumalran mu, pakalrazam kaninku zatu pinarevuwa' tu ngadan, zi kirekalrazam ku tu niruma'enan, zi nantu zekalr.
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

kiumalr ku kantaw kemuda zi marukerang patrutru kana puwavalis za ngadan, a awatr ziya na ipuvalray 'azi 'inava ziya maw?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

marengay kaninku i intaw, 'alrana pimanayaw za valray na minkuk 'azi karuwa patulre'ay paredek za tu ngadan, nu venavina a trau kantaw mu “izu i... eman” kema, zi mawna kemazu mupana lra a kalikeliked na sime'an na ngai.

marengay i Avarang, “na vinavalray kanantu valray na Yéncumin na ngadan mu maw tatena' nanta ngadan. nanku ngadan paruveli kananta 'inalrayan, nanta niruma'enan, nanta kinayanan, kiyalriman kana kazuwan ta mawan atrevung tu ngadan i intaw.”
Avarang said, 'The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group, our family, our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.'
大家好。我們開始了。: Avarang說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

a daman marelrang mi iniyam i mulri na vavayan mukuwa kana kazuwan na trau puwayar meniwana, i mulri na vavayan mu miinurung za sazu za tu sinalem na kulang, zi demaway ziya kana imaran na akanan na Yéncumin veray kana mapiyapiya.

nu demeru za eman i mulri na vavayan mu, kazu ku i saninin demadaulr kana lavang, kematamuni ku 'emuy'uy i ngaydiran, “taw sinalem na lulang peniya, 'azi pinuwatremel, kadika alamu tremima'a mu!”

dika mi piya meniwan naniyam emaeman, “'alrana mau i inu na puwalrang.” kema i mulri na vavayan.

ini na kahuwahuwan mu, kipanadam ku lra kanizu na tematelriw ziya i dare' kana Yécumin zi kalrazaman za akanan, pawnung atalram lra tu ulepan za puwayar meniwan.

mena'u lra kani i mulri na vavayan tu kinasahasahar na akanan na trungulran, paremamatras ku zi salaw ku semangal.
